creditline: Gift of The James Castle Collection, Boise, Idaho
description: recto: tall, thin couple-man wears a hat and woman wears a sun bonnet-with dog or other animal standing at R; couple looks at a fancy screen door decorated with spindles; verso: "Gay Nineties" cookie assortment label with printed image of a tray of cookies. Unsigned.
image_copyright: Copyright © 2018 James Castle Collection and Archive LP%2C All rights reserved.
medium: Soot, soot wash, and traces of white wash on thin tan found cardboard (commercially printed Gay Nineties Cookie Assortment packaging)
provenance: The artist, Boise, Idaho; Estate of the artist, Boise, Idaho; given to MIA, 2007.
text: This simple domestic scene features representational figures of a man, woman, and dog standing outside the door of a house. Though little is known about the subject, it may be a variation of Castle’s so-called dream house drawings, which he made regularly as visualizations of his longing for a home and family of his own. Castle’s abiding interest in patterns is evident in the prominence of the wooden screen door and its ornate Victorian-style embellishments.
title: Untitled (Outdoor scene with man, woman, dog, and decorative screen door)
